title: FST--T205's, 16 ungraded with 6 h-o-f-; 16 graded, P-VG
author: dougscats

posts.post_title: FST--T205's, 16 ungraded with 6 h-o-f-; 16 graded, P-VG
posts.post_content:
The 16 ungraded range from Poor to Good.

I'd rather trade. I am continually upgrading [looking for many hall-of-famers, SL's, SP's, Fair-Good or better, commons, G-VG or better], also interested in T206's.  So, if you're interested in trading, let me know what you have. I prefer ungraded cards.
 
The ungraded commons range in price from $10-$20, hall-of-famers, $30-50.  The Bobby Wallace, no cap, I have yet to figure out.
If you're interested in an individual card/cards, let me know and I'll give you a price. I'll reserve cards for sale as of now.  Discounts for multiple items and combined shipping. 

--First to commit to a card gets it--

Most forms of payment okay; paypal as friend; thanks.

My PM Box is often full, so please email: [url]djdoremus@msn.com[/url]

List of ungraded T205's:

Moran,
Summers,
COLLINS, closed mouth,
WHEAT,
JENNINGS, 
JENNINGS [lesser condition],
Downey,--SOLD--
McGRAW [short],
WALLACE, no cap,
Maddox [miscut on back],
Crandall, t crossed, 
Parent,--SOLD-- 
Hauser,
Briscoe Lord,
Willet,

Hoblitzell, Cin after date, Poor--not depicted--scans upon request

Graded T205:

Adkins/ML,      Hassan,        SGC 20,
Bergen,             Sovereign,   SGC 40,
Birmingham,    Polar Bear,  SGC 40,
Corridon,          Sovereign,   SGC 40,
Devore,            Sweet Cap   SGC 10,
Foxen,              Piedmont,    SGC 40,
Gardner,          Piedmont,    SGC 30,
Gaspar,            Piedmont,    SGC 40,
Latham, A. on back, Pied., SGC 30,
Lush,                 Sweet Cap  SGC 40,
Leach,              Piedmont,   SGC 40,
Mattern,          Piedmont,   SGC 30,
Scott,                Sweet Cap  SGC 30,
Sweeney, SP,   Polar Bear,  SGC 10,
Wiltse, both ears, Cycle,    SGC 30,
WALLACE with cap, Pied.  PSA 1.5

*Note on Scans: As the page is turned, the backs are in reverse order. 
Also, the cards are in two protective plastics, a halved penny-sleeve--which creates the appearance of a vertical line on each card--and a pocket-page.

Note on Wallace, no cap: It's a very wide card, measuring a full 1 1/2" across.
